meta.title: Reflections
meta.description: Reflections on building systems, clarifying intent, and designing ways of working that hold up under change.

sections.intro: Most of what I’ve learned about building systems hasn’t come from getting things right the first time. It’s come from noticing where friction kept appearing — and then tracing it backward. Writing is part of how I close that loop. These pieces reflect on moments where execution struggled, clarity broke down, or systems drifted — and what changed once intent, context, and structure moved earlier in the process.

articles.title: The More Time We Spent Defining the Direction, the Better the Outcome
articles.summary: A reflection on how slowing down early to clarify intent consistently led to calmer execution and more durable systems.

articles.title: When Precision Turns Into Omission
articles.summary: On low-context communication, broken troubleshooting loops, and why preparation is itself a form of leadership.

articles.title: I Didn’t Just Want to Build an App
articles.summary: Why shifting focus from one-off outcomes to repeatable practice changed how I approach product and systems work.
